meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These rules may be cited as the Adoption Rules.

subsection.leadIn: In these rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: adoption order (領養令) means an adoption order other than a Convention adoption order; (L.N. 230 of 2005)
guardian ad litem (訴訟監護人) means the guardian ad litem of an infant for the purposes of the application for an adoption order that relates to the infant; (L.N. 230 of 2005)
Ordinance (本條例) means the Adoption Ordinance (Cap. 290).

subsection.content: A form referred to by number means the form so numbered in Schedule 1. (G.N.A. 76 of 1960; L.N. 230 of 2005)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Application
section.content: These rules do not apply to or in relation to Convention adoption.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notice of intention
section.content: A notice of intention to apply for an adoption order shall be in accordance with Form 1.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Proceedings to be disposed of in private
section.content: All proceedings under the Ordinance are to be disposed of in private.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Form of application
section.content: An application for an adoption order shall be made to the Court by originating summons in Form 2. The proposed adopter shall be the applicant and the infant shall be the respondent.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Identity of applicant may be kept confidential
section.content: If any person proposing to apply to the Court for an adoption order desires that his identity shall be kept confidential, he may, before taking out an originating summons, apply to the Court for a serial number to be assigned to him for the purposes of the proposed application and such a number shall be assigned to him accordingly.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Previous applications
section.content: If it appears that the applicant has previously made an application to any court in Hong Kong for the adoption of the same infant, the application shall not be proceeded with unless the judge is satisfied that there has been a material change in the circumstances since the previous application.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Director of Social Welfare to be guardian ad litem subject to rule 9

subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of rule 9, the Director shall be the guardian ad litem of the infant for the purposes of the application and a copy of the summons shall be served on him.

content.leadIn: On the service of a copy of the summons in accordance with paragraph (1), the applicant shall pay to the Director a fee of $4,440 in payment of the proper costs of the Director for acting as guardian ad litem for the infant: (L.N. 228 of 1977; L.N. 55 of 1987; L.N. 60 of 1990; L.N. 309 of 1992; L.N. 74 of 1994; L.N. 27 of 1995; L.N. 161 of 1996; L.N. 157 of 1997; L.N. 56 of 2015; L.N. 143 of 2023)
content.proviso: Provided that the Director, if he should consider such action is necessary or desirable, may waive payment of such fee or any part thereof. (L.N. 230 of 2005)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Appointment of some other person as guardian ad litem

subsection.leadIn: Except where the Director has become guardian ad litem by virtue of section 5(5F) of the Ordinance, if the applicant desires that some person other than the Director should be appointed to act as guardian ad litem, then— (28 of 2004 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the originating summons must ask for the appointment of a guardian ad litem and must be supported by an affidavit by the applicant setting out the grounds for asking for such appointment together with the consent to act in writing of the proposed guardian ad litem; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the originating summons shall be served on the Director,

subsection.continued: and the judge may appoint such person as he thinks fit to be the guardian ad litem. (G.N.A. 76 of 1960; L.N. 228 of 1977; L.N. 139 of 1986; 98 of 1991 s. 9; 28 of 2004 s. 35)

subsection.content: The court may at any time, where it considers it to be in the interests of the infant, appoint the Official Solicitor to be the guardian ad litem of the infant in place of any person. (98 of 1991 s. 9)
The evidence in support of the application for an adoption order shall be given by means of a statement in Form 3 and shall be verified by affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: Any document signifying the consent of any person to the making of the order shall be exhibited to the affidavit and the consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if given by a parent of the infant, shall be in either Form 4, Form 4A or Form 4B (as may be appropriate);

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a guardian of the infant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is liable to contribute to the maintenance of the infant by virtue of any order or agreement,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if given by a spouse of the applicant and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the spouse is a parent of the infant, shall be in either Form 4, Form 4A or Form 4B (as may be appropriate);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the spouse is not a parent of the infant, shall be in Form 4. (L.N. 230 of 2005)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Time for filing evidence
section.content: The said evidence shall be filed within 14 days after the issue of the originating summons and a copy of the applicant’s statement and of the documents attached thereto shall at the same time be served on the guardian ad litem.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Form of notice
section.leadIn: The guardian ad litem shall as soon as practicable serve a notice in Form 5 on any parent or guardian of the infant who has signified his consent to the making of an adoption order:
section.proviso: Provided that the notice shall not require to be served on any parent who has given consent to an adoption order by way of general consent in Form 4A unless, within the period of 3 months from the day on which that form was executed, a copy of the originating summons in Form 2 has been served on the Director in accordance with rule 8(1). (L.N. 228 of 1977)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Guardian ad litem to investigate all relevant circumstances
section.leadIn: It shall be the duty of the guardian ad litem to investigate as fully as possible all circumstances relevant to the proposed adoption with a view to safeguarding the interests of the infant before the Court and to make a report to the Court for that purpose; and in particular it shall be his duty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make inquiries as to all matters alleged in the applicant’s statement and as to the additional matters specified in Schedule 2 and to report to the Court upon them; (L.N. 230 of 2005)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to interview (either by himself or by an agent appointed by him for the purpose) every individual being an applicant for the order, or mentioned in the applicant’s statement as a person to whom reference may be made, or a person on whom notice of the application is required to be served under rule 16, or, where notice is required to be served on a body of persons, the appropriate officer of such body.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Information to be confidential
section.content: The guardian ad litem and any agent of his and, where a body of persons is appointed as guardian ad litem, every officer, employee and member of that body shall treat as confidential all information obtained in the course of the investigation, and shall not divulge any part of it to any other person except so far as may be necessary for the proper execution of his duty.

main.crossHeading: Application under Section 5(5D) of the Ordinance

subsection.content: An application by a parent under section 5(5D) of the Ordinance for an order revoking that parent’s consent given in the prescribed general form of consent shall be made to the Court of First Instance in accordance with paragraph (2) and the proceedings shall thereupon be transferred to the Court of First Instance. (L.N. 337 of 1982)

subsection.leadIn: The application under paragraph (1) shall be made—

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: if an application for a Convention adoption order is pending, in accordance with rule 14 of the Convention Adoption Rules (Cap. 290 sub. leg. D); (L.N. 230 of 2005)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if no application referred to in subparagraphs (aa) and (a) is pending, by originating summons. (L.N. 230 of 2005)

subsection.content: The Registrar of the High Court, after giving such directions (if any) as he thinks necessary, shall fix a date for the hearing of the application. (L.N. 230 of 2005)

subsection.leadIn: When the date for the hearing has been fixed, the Registrar of the High Court shall serve a copy of the summons or originating summons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an application made in pending adoption proceedings (or where adoption proceedings have subsequently been commenced) on the applicant in those proceedings, on the guardian ad litem and on every other person on whom notice has been or will in due course be served under rule 16;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, on the guardian ad litem and on any other person or body who in the Registrar’s opinion ought to be served with notice of the hearing of the application.

subsection.leadIn: If in any application under this rule a serial number has been assigned to a person who proposes to apply for an adoption order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the documents to be served under paragraph (4) shall not disclose the identity of that person to any other person who is not already aware of that person’s identity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings on the application shall be conducted with a view to securing that that person is not seen by or made known to any other person concerned with the application who is not already aware of his identity, except with his consent.

subsection.content: Where the application is determined, the Registrar of the High Court shall serve notice of the effect of the determination and any order on the applicant and on all the persons served under paragraph (4).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Appointment for hearing
section.content: The applicant shall obtain an appointment for the hearing of the application within 14 days after being notified by the guardian ad litem that he has made his report to the Court. If no appointment is obtained by the applicant, the guardian ad litem shall obtain an appointment as soon as practicable for the hearing of the application.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Notice of hearing
section.leadIn: On a date being fixed for the hearing of the application, the guardian ad litem shall serve a notice in Form 6 on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every person whose consent to the order is required under section 5(5) of the Ordinance; and

content.leadIn: the Director (if he is not the guardian ad litem): (G.N.A. 76 of 1960)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.content: Provided that where the Court is satisfied that any person whose consent to the order is required by section 5(5) of the Ordinance cannot be found and that all reasonable steps have been taken to trace such person the Court may if it thinks fit dispense with service of the notice under this section on such person: (L.N. 54 of 1965)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided also that it shall not be necessary to serve the notice on— (L.N. 230 of 2005)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Director if he is a guardian of the infant by virtue of the Protection of Children and Juveniles Ordinance (Cap. 213); or (10 of 2008 s. 44)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the parent of an infant who has given consent to an adoption order by way of general consent in Form 4A unless the hearing is to take place within 3 months from the day on which the form was executed. (L.N. 228 of 1977)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Appearance to show cause why order should not be made

subsection.content: On the hearing of the application any person on whom notice is required to be served under rule 16 may appear before the District Judge to show cause why an adoption order should not be made. The Director may be represented by any public officer duly authorized in that behalf by the Director. (G.N.A. 76 of 1960; L.N. 337 of 1982)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person whose consent is required under section 5(5)(a) of the Ordinance fails to give consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person having a proper interest in the application objects to an adoption order being made,

subsection.continued: the District Court shall transfer the application to the Court of First Instance. (L.N. 337 of 1982)

subsection.content: Any application transferred to the Court of First Instance under paragraph (2) may be retransferred to the District Court at any stage if the Court of First Instance considers that the provisions of section 4A of the Ordinance do not or no longer require it to be continued in the Court of First Instance. (L.N. 337 of 1982)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Conduct of proceedings
section.content: Unless the Court is satisfied that the applicant does not desire his identity to be kept confidential, the proceedings shall be conducted with a view to securing that he is not seen by or made known to any person (other than the spouse of the applicant) whose consent to the order is required.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Form of order
section.content: Unless the Court otherwise orders, an adoption order shall be drawn up in Form 7, and an interim order in Form 8.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Copy of the order to be sent to Registrar of Births and Deaths and applicant
section.text: On the making of an adoption order, the Registrar of the High Court or the District Court shall send a sealed copy of the order to the Registrar of Births and Deaths and to the applicant within 7 days after the order has been passed and entered.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Copy of order not to be given to other persons
section.content: No duplicate or copy of an adoption order or interim order shall be given to or served upon any person other than the Registrar of Births and Deaths or the applicant except by order of the judge.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Notification by guardian ad litem of making or refusal of order
section.content: Where an adoption order is made or refused or an interim order made, the guardian ad litem shall notify all parties who were not present when the order was made or refused, without disclosing the identity of the applicant unless he does not desire his identity to be kept confidential.

main.crossHeading: Restoration of Proceedings after Interim Order

section.name: s23
section.heading: Application for further hearing by applicant
section.content: Where the determination of an application is postponed and an interim order made the applicant shall, at least 2 months before the expiration of the period specified in the interim order, obtain an appointment for the further hearing of the application, and the guardian ad litem shall serve a notice in Form 9 on every person on whom notice is required to be served under rule 16.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Application for further hearing by guardian ad litem
section.content: If no appointment is obtained by the applicant as required by rule 23, the guardian ad litem shall obtain an appointment as soon as practicable for the further hearing of the application.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Amendment of adoption orders, and revocation of directions ex parte
section.content: An application for an order under section 20(1) of the Ordinance for the amendment of an adoption order or the revocation of a direction for the marking of an entry in the registers of births or the Adopted Children Register may be made ex parte in the first instance in the Court, but the Court may require notice of that application to be served on such persons as it thinks fit.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Notice of amendment to be sent to Registrar of Births and Deaths
section.text: Where an order for the amendment of an adoption order or the revocation of a direction for the marking of an entry in the registers of births or the Adopted Children Register is made under section 20(1) of the Ordinance, the Registrar of the High Court or the District Court shall send to the Registrar of Births and Deaths a notice specifying the date of the adoption order and the names of the adopter and of the adopted person (as described in the schedule to the adoption order) and stating what amendments are to be made in the particulars specified in that order.

main.crossHeading: Delegation by Director of Social Welfare

section.name: s27
section.heading: Delegation of powers and duties
section.content: Where the Director is acting under these rules as guardian ad litem, anything required or authorized by these rules to be done by the guardian ad litem may be done by any public officer duly authorized in that behalf by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), a document required to be served under these rules may be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to the individual personally;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it with some person for the individual at the individual’s last known address or usual place of abode; or

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to him at his principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to him by registered post addressed to him at his principal office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body of persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to that body at that body’s registered or principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to that body by registered post addressed to that body at that body’s registered or principal office.

subsection.leadIn: Where a document is to be served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual whose last known address or usual place of abode is in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body of persons whose registered or principal office is in a place outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the document must be served in accordance with the law of that place.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Persons who may attest documents and declarations outside Hong Kong
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7(2) of the Ordinance, a document or declaration executed or made by any person outside Hong Kong shall be sufficiently attested if it is attested as follows— (66 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the document or declaration is executed or made at a place outside Hong Kong— (L.N. 230 of 2005)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by any person for the time being authorized by law in that place to administer an oath for any judicial or other legal purpose. (L.N. 45 of 1973; 28 of 2004 s. 35; 2 of 2012 s. 3)

main.crossHeading: Application under Section 6(4) of the Ordinance

section.name: s30
section.heading: Making and notice of application
section.content: An application under section 6(4) of the Ordinance for leave to remove the infant from the care and possession of the applicant shall be made to the judge, and notice thereof shall be served on the guardian ad litem.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Dismissal of application for adoption order
section.content: Where leave to remove the infant from the care and possession of the applicant is granted under section 6(4) of the Ordinance, the judge may, upon granting leave, dismiss the application for the adoption order.

main.crossHeading: Applications under Section 23B of the Ordinance

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Application for an order passing care and control of infant

subsection.content: An application for an order under section 23B(1) of the Ordinance for passing the care and control of an infant to a person authorized by the Director may be made to the Court by the Director by an ex parte originating summons.
The application shall be heard by a judge.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be supported by an affidavit by the Director that sets out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information on the infant’s identity, adoptability, background, social environment, family history and medical history;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: details of the person authorized by the Director for the purposes of section 23B(1) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the grounds for the Director’s belief that the granting of the order will be in the best interests of the infant.

subsection.leadIn: The following documents shall be exhibited to the affidavit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the infant’s birth certificate or any other proof of identity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order by which the Director was appointed as the legal guardian of the infant (if applicable);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consent of every person whose consent is required by section 5(5)(a) of the Ordinance (if applicable);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: order declaring that the infant is freed for adoption under section 5A of the Ordinance (if applicable);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: copy of the infant study report;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: statement of acceptance for adoption signed by the prospective adopter;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: copy of the family study and assessment report of the prospective adopter; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: letter of assumption of responsibility signed by the person referred to in paragraph (3)(b) stating that such person is responsible for the welfare of the infant while the infant is in the state to which the infant is intended to be sent and before the infant is adopted.

subsection.def: In this rule, Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance.

main.crossHeading: Application of Practice of the District Court and of the Court of First Instance

section.name: s32
section.heading: Practice and procedure of District Court and of Court of First Instance to apply
section.content: Subject to these rules, the practice and procedure of the District Court and of the Court of First Instance shall apply to proceedings under the Ordinance.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Court fees not charged
section.content: No court fees shall be charged in adoption proceedings.

Where the name of applicant is not known to the consenting party, and a serial number has been obtained for the application under rule 6 of the Adoption Rules, complete the entry contained in the second square brackets.

If the infant has not been adopted, a birth certificate should be attached. If there is no such certificate, a certified copy of the document showing that the consenting party has parental rights over the infant should be attached.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Additional Matters Subject to Investigation and Report by Guardian Ad Litem

section.name: s1
section.content: In the case of a joint application, how long the applicants have been married.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In the case of an application by one only of 2 spouses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the other spouse consents to the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: why he or she does not join in the application.

section.name: s3
section.content: What other children (including adopted children) the applicant has.

section.name: s4
section.content: What is the age and sex of all children living in the home of the applicant, and what is their relationship to the applicant.

section.name: s5
section.content: What number of living rooms and bedrooms are contained in the home of the applicant, and what is the condition of the home.

section.name: s6
section.content: What are the means of the applicant.

section.name: s7
section.content: Whether the applicant suffers or has suffered from any serious illness, and whether there is any history of tuberculosis, epilepsy or mental illness in his or her family.

section.name: s8
section.content: Whether any person specified in the applicant’s statement as a person to whom reference may be made is a responsible person and recommends the applicant without reservation.

section.name: s9
section.content: Whether the applicant understands that an adoption order is irrevocable and that the order if made will render him or her responsible for the maintenance and upbringing of the infant.

section.name: s10
section.content: Whether the infant has any right to or interest in any property.

section.name: s11
section.content: Whether the infant (if of an age to understand the effect of an adoption order) wishes the order to be made.

section.name: s12
section.content: Whether the mother consents to the adoption and identifies the birth certificate (if any) attached to the applicant’s statement as the birth certificate of the infant.

section.name: s13
section.content: Whether the father consents to the adoption.

section.name: s14
section.content: If the infant is born out of wedlock, whether an order has been made adjudging any person to be the putative father of the infant, or an agreement to contribute to the maintenance of the infant has been made by a person acknowledging himself to be the father of the infant, and in either case whether that person consents to the adoption. (L.N. 162 of 1993; 28 of 2004 s. 35)

section.name: s15
section.content: When did the parent or parents part with the infant, and to whom.

section.name: s16
section.content: What are the reasons of the parent or parents for consenting to the adoption, and whether his or their consent is given without pressure from other persons.

section.name: s17
section.content: Whether the parent, or each of the parents, understands that an adoption order is irrevocable, and that the order if made will deprive him or her of all rights in respect of the maintenance and upbringing of the infant.

section.name: s18
section.content: Where the applicant’s statement requests the judge to dispense with the consent of the parent, or either of the parents, on the ground that he or she cannot be found, what steps have been taken to trace him or her.
